src/components/forms/CurrencyInput.react.js
CurrencyInput
description:
A component that allows entering a decimal value and always shows it with fixed
precision, prefixed by a currency symbol.

Default validation options:
 * `errors`: ['isCurrency', {@link min}, {@link max}],
 * `sanitizers`: `['toFloat']`
 * `formatters`: [{@link decimalPlaces}]

Default props: `{type: 'number', decimalPlaces: 2, currency: '$'}`

name: src/components/forms/DecimalInput.react.js
DecimalInput
description:
A component that allows entering a decimal value and always shows it with fixed
precision.

Default validation options:
 * `errors`: ['isDecimal', {@link min}, {@link max}],
 * `sanitizers`: `['toFloat']`
 * `formatters`: [{@link decimalPlaces}]

Default props: `{type: 'number', decimalPlaces: 2}`

name: src/components/forms/EmailInput.react.js
EmailInput
description:
A component that allows entering and eamil address.

Default validation options:
 * `errors`: `['isEmail']`,
 * `sanitizers`: `['normalizeEmail']`

Default props: `{type: 'email'}`

name: src/components/forms/FloatInput.react.js
FloatInput
description:
A component that allows entering a float number.

Default validation options:
 * `errors`: ['isFloat', {@link min}, {@link max}],
 * `sanitizers`: `['toFloat']`

Default props: `{type: 'number', step: 0.1}`

name: src/components/forms/IntegerInput.react.js
IntegerInput
description:
A component that allows entering an integer number.

Default validation options:
 * `errors`: ['isInt', {@link min}, {@link max}],
 * `sanitizers`: `['toInt']`

Default props: `{type: 'number'}`

name: src/components/forms/NumberInput.react.js
NumberInput
description:
A component to validate a number.

Default validation options:
 * `errors`: [{@link min}, {@link max}],
 * `sanitizers`: `['toFloat']`

Default props: `{type: 'number'}`

name: src/components/forms/PasswordInput.react.js
PasswordInput
description: A component for entering a password. The `type` props is hardcoded to `'password'`.

name: src/components/forms/TextInput.react.js
TextInput
description:
A component that allows entering text.

Default validation options: `{sanitizers: ['trim']}`

Default props: `{type: 'text'}`

name: src/components/forms/formatters.js
decimalPlaces
description:
Return a fixed-precision representation of the given value, according to
`props.decimalPlaces`

return.description:
The formatted valued, or `null` if `value` is the
emptry string.

name: src/components/forms/index.js
src/components/forms/props.js
content:
import React from 'react';


export const inputPropTypes = {
  inputProps: React.PropTypes.shape({
    type: React.PropTypes.string,
    value: React.PropTypes.any,
    name: React.PropTypes.string.isRequired,
    onChange: React.PropTypes.func,
    onBlur: React.PropTypes.func,
    onFocus: React.PropTypes.func,
    placeholder: React.PropTypes.string,
    required: React.PropTypes.bool,
    disabled: React.PropTypes.bool,
    readOnly: React.PropTypes.bool,
    maxLength: React.PropTypes.number,
  }),
  errors: React.PropTypes.array,
  warning: React.PropTypes.array,
  sanitizers: React.PropTypes.array,
  formatters: React.PropTypes.array,
  messages: React.PropTypes.array,
  validationState: React.PropTypes.string,
};


export const reduxFormPropTypes = {
  input: React.PropTypes.object,
  label: React.PropTypes.string,
  type: React.PropTypes.string,
  meta: React.PropTypes.object,
  error: React.PropTypes.any,
  pristine: React.PropTypes.bool,
  reset: React.PropTypes.func,
  submitting: React.PropTypes.bool,
  handleSubmit: React.PropTypes.func,
};


export function getInputProps(props) {
  return {
    value: props.value,
    name: props.name,
    type: props.type,
    min: props.min,
    max: props.max,
    step: props.step,
    readOnly: props.readOnly,
    required: props.required,
    onBlur: props.onBlur,
    onChange: props.onChange,
    onFocus: props.onFocus,
  };
}

name: src/components/forms/validators.js
min
description: Check if the provided values is smaller than the `min` prop.

name: max
description: Check if the provided values is greater than the `max` prop.

name: src/decorators/forms/index.js
src/decorators/forms/validates.js
stringValue
description:
Convert a value to a string, if possible. Otherwise returns the unchanged
value. `null` and `undefined` are coerced to the empty string.

return.description: Either the value converted to a string, or the vlaue itself.

name: ValidationOptions
description: Options to validate a component

properties.name: errors
properties.description:
An array of validators
that may return an error message. For available strings, see the npm [validator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/validator) package

properties.name: warnings
properties.description:
An array of validators
that may return a warning message. For available strings, see the npm [validator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/validator) package

properties.name: sanitizers
properties.description:
An array of saniters
to modify the field's returned value. For available strings, see the npm [validator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/validator) package

properties.name: formatters
properties.description:
An array of saniters
to modify the field's rendered value.

name: validateField
description: Add value validation to a single field.

src/decorators/simpl.js
simpl
description: Decorator to wrap your main app

params.name: options.username
params.description: The username for authenticating on the WAMP Router.

params.name: options.password
params.description: The password for authenticating on the WAMP Router.

params.name: options.url
params.description: The URL of the WAMP router.

params.name: options.progressComponent
params.description:
A customized Component to show
the App's connection state. The component will receive a `progress` prop which
can have one of the following values:
* `offline`: The initial value. The app is not connected to the WAMP Router, yet.
* `connected`: The app is connected and authenticated, but it still needs to download data.
* `loaded`: The app has downloaded all the relevant data.

params.name: options.topics
params.description: A function return a list of topic to subsribe to.

params.name: options.prefixes
params.description:
An object mapping names to topic prefixes,
to be used as shortcuts.

description: An action that's serializable to the provided action name.

params.name: type

name: createNamedAction
description:
Shortcut function to create an action that's serializable to a string and usable
as an object property.
Use this to create an option that's usable from within a reducer.

params.name: args
params.description: Additional arguments to pass to redux-actions.createAction.
